summary: Screen Time Health Intelligence React app with Firebase Google Auth, AI risk scoring (deterministic email-hash-based), and interactive Chart.js visualizations. Hackathon-ready demo with simulated data, no backend required.
architectural_notes: React (CRA) + Firebase Auth (Google) + react-chartjs-2 + chart.js stack
Deterministic risk scores generated from email hash — no backend needed
All chart data is simulated; app works fully with placeholder Firebase config
Files: src/firebaseConfig.js, src/App.js, src/Login.js, src/Dashboard.js, src/App.css
Must register all Chart.js components: CategoryScale, LinearScale, PointElement, LineElement, BarElement, Title, Tooltip, Legend
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Screen time health app hero logo — a glowing shield icon with an eye and waveform motif on a deep blue background (logo-shield.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication (using the existing useInternetIdentity hook) as the login mechanism. Display a centered login screen with the app title 'Screen Time Health Intelligence', subtitle 'AI-powered behavioral risk prediction for burnout & fatigue', and a prominent login button. Show a card-style design with a deep blue gradient background.

Build a full-featured Dashboard page accessible only when authenticated. Include: (1) a top navbar with the app name on the left and user identity info plus a logout button on the right; (2) a welcome section showing 'Welcome back, {identity}' and the user's principal; (3) four metric cards (Burnout Risk, Eye Strain Risk, Sleep Disruption, Overall Health Score) with color-coded left borders and large percentage values; (4) deterministic risk score generation based on a hash of the user's principal string using the formula: burnout = 45 + (hash % 40), eyeStrain = 50 + (hash % 35), sleepDisruption = 30 + (hash % 45), healthScore = 100 - (40 + (hash % 30)); (5) trend indicators on each metric card.

Add a Line Chart on the Dashboard titled 'Screen Time vs Burnout Risk (Last 7 Days)' using react-chartjs-2 and Chart.js. Register all required Chart.js components (CategoryScale, LinearScale, PointElement, LineElement, BarElement, Title, Tooltip, Legend). The chart must show two datasets: Screen Time (hours) and Burnout Risk (%), with labels Mon–Sun and realistic simulated data.

Add a Bar Chart on the Dashboard titled 'Daily App Usage Breakdown' using react-chartjs-2. Show five categories: Social Media, Work Apps, Entertainment, News, Health Apps with colorful bars representing hours per day (simulated data). Display inside a white card.

Add a Risk Analysis section on the Dashboard with two columns: 'Risk Factors Detected' (with warning icons) listing: Late night usage detected, Extended continuous sessions, High social media ratio, Insufficient break intervals; and 'Recommendations' (with checkmark icons) listing: Take 20-20-20 eye breaks, Limit screens after 9 PM, Use app timers for social media, Enable night mode after sunset. Style risk factors in a red-tinted card and recommendations in a green-tinted card.

Apply a professional, hackathon-ready visual theme across the entire app: deep blue gradient (#1e3c72 to #2a5298) for the header/navbar, white cards with subtle box shadows, orange accent color (#ff7a18) for CTAs and highlights, clean system font typography, responsive grid layouts for metric cards, smooth hover transitions on cards, and consistent spacing throughout.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Motoko backend actor that stores per-user health metrics and screen time data. Expose query and update methods for saving and retrieving risk scores and simulated usage data, keyed by user principal.
